THANK YOU! I've been looking for this film for YEARS! I'm really looking forward to watching it. :) :) :)

This is an amazing movie - it's shot like a fly-on-the-wall documentary, to emphasize how ordinary people can make history. 

Please seed! I'm seeding at a 4-1 ratio, I know there are folks who've got their 100% since I've started, and yet I'm still the only seeder. I'm going to seed for another few days, but I've got a low bandwidth and need other people to take over.

The Paris Commune tried to smash private property - so does P2P! Leechers drain our collective resources like capital drains the workers of surplus value! So... seed please :-)

hi there,

thanks so much for sharing this--it's a great movie thus far!  (i'm about two hours into it)

i'm worried, though, that the sound and video go out of joint at a certain point--that is to say, that's there's a lag between the two.  is this normal?  do other people have this problem with it?  is it just my computer?  what should i do?

any advice someone could give on this would be greatly appreciated!
Paris commune(1871) was the most democratic system in the human history. The current most democratic capitalist system are not even near to its democratic values.
